shared_text:
BYU Idaho Home & Family Department
October 8, 2019 at 2:09 PM ·

Just like many industries today, technology has changed the world of apparel design.

Genet Nielsen Orme is one of two full-time apparel design professors at BYU-Idaho. She’s been teaching here for four years and helped build the apparel design major. She collaborates with organizations on campus to create Fashion Shows on campus!

BIO:
She received aB.S. Clothing & Textiles at BYU Provo and later completed a M.Ed. Southern Utah University.

Her experience includes 9 years FCS secondary Ed teacher in Utah, 3 years Sacramento City College, Apparel Design, 3 years Oroville Adult School, and 25 years free-lance teaching in professional workshops nationwide!

Some of her hobbies include spending time with her family, Apparel Design, yard work, and exercising.

post_text:
Tonight, OUHSD administration was alerted to a post on social media where a threat was made to Las Plumas. Butte County Sheriff was immediately called.

In the last few minutes, BCSO has alerted OUHSD that the person making the threats was located and taken into custody. BCSO will release more information as it become available. Also, as this is an open investigation we are unable to give many details, those details will come from BCSO in a media release. We will post it here when it is available.

The safety of our staff and students is our highest priority. Immediate action was taken by staff and BCSO. School is in session tomorrow as we feel there is no longer a threat.

The safety of our staff and students are very important. During school hours, students and staff cross at that intersection every hour. We were lucky that no one received major injuries or worse. Please be extra careful when driving through that intersection.
